channel.title: How does ::setlvls and ::combat works?

item.title: How does ::setlvls and ::combat works?
item.dc:creator: @santaguy santaguy
item.description:
@santaguy wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“setlvls”) && playerRights >= 2)
{
addSkillXP(14910000, 0);
addSkillXP(14910000, 1);
addSkillXP(14910000, 2);
addSkillXP(14910000, 3);
addSkillXP(14910000, 4);
addSkillXP(14910000, 5);
addSkillXP(14910000, 6);
addSkillXP(14910000, 7);
addSkillXP(14910000, 8);
addSkillXP(14910000, 9);

addSkillXP(14910000, 11);

addSkillXP(14910000, 17);

addSkillXP(14910000, 19);
addSkillXP(14910000, 20);
addSkillXP(14910000, 21);
addSkillXP(14910000, 22);
addSkillXP(14910000, 23);
sendMessage(""+ playerName +" … your a nerd.");
}

item.title: How does ::setlvls and ::combat works?

it adds that xp to all the lvls i guess.

item.title: How does ::setlvls and ::combat works?
item.dc:creator: @jarnohhh jarnohhh
item.description:
@jarnohhh wrote:

Yeah how does these commands works?

if(command.startsWith("setlvls") && playerRights >= 2) { int xp = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(8)); int Attackxp = xp; int Strengthxp = xp; int Defencexp = xp; int Hitpointsxp = xp; int Prayerxp = xp; int Magicxp = xp; int Rangexp = xp; int Runecraftxp = xp; int Herblorexp = xp; int Agilityxp = xp; int Craftingxp = xp; int Fletchingxp = xp; int Slayerxp = xp; int Miningxp = xp; int Smithingxp = xp; int Fishingxp = xp; int Cookingxp = xp; int Firemakingxp = xp; int Woodcuttingxp = xp; int Farmingxp = xp; saveStats(); } if(command.startsWith("combat") && playerRights >= 2) { int newcombat = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6)); combat = newcombat; saveStats(); }

Read full topic
